item.title: The Best Marketing Dollars I Have Ever Spent On My Business | Fstoppers
item.description:
The Best Marketing Dollars I Have Ever Spent On My Business | Fstoppers

"Trevor, I see that a lot of people are visiting my site, but no one is contacting me for business. What can I do better?" I get this question quite a bit either via email or at the workshops I teach and while there is no magic solution that will work for everyone, I'd love to share what has been the biggest game changer for me in my business.

item.title: 26.5 Tips On Becoming The Perfect Second Shooter | Fstoppers
item.description:
26.5 Tips On Becoming The Perfect Second Shooter | Fstoppers

As a wedding photographer I am always on the hunt for that perfect second shooter. Over the last 4 years I have shot 120+ weddings and worked with over 70 different second shooters. Most of them have been fantastic but I have always thought it would be nice to have a list of second shooter tips I could send them before the wedding day.

item.title: My Favorite New Photography Tool When I Travel | Fstoppers
item.description:
My Favorite New Photography Tool When I Travel | Fstoppers

I have had the privilege of traveling all over the world as a photographer and love shooting photos of locals. They always light up seeing the images of themselves. However, I realized that while they loved seeing the images on the back of my camera, I was missing something important.

item.title: Keyboard Shortcuts Worth Learning for the Crop Tool in Lightroom | Fstoppers
item.description:
Keyboard Shortcuts Worth Learning for the Crop Tool in Lightroom | Fstoppers

I am a keyboard shortcut junkie. Anytime I can find a way to do something quicker using a keyboard shortcut I will force myself to use it for a few days till I have built it into my workflow. A few of my favorite keyboard shortcuts are found in the Lightroom Crop Tool.

item.title: Effective Tips on Using the Lightroom Adjustment Brush | Fstoppers
item.description:
Effective Tips on Using the Lightroom Adjustment Brush | Fstoppers

Lightroom is a software full of useful tools, but more often than not I see photographers not taking full advantage of them and resorting to do simple edits in other programs such as Photoshop. I put together this short 7 minute video covering some useful tips on using one of my favorite tools to quickly enhance my photos in Lightroom - The Adjustment Brush.

item.title: Learn To Shoot Proper White Balance using Kelvin Temps | Fstoppers
item.description:
Learn To Shoot Proper White Balance using Kelvin Temps | Fstoppers

Over the years, I have taught numerous workshops for photographers and during those classes one of the most appreciated techniques that we discuss is shooting proper white balance using Kelvin temperatures. If it is something new to you, it might at first seem a bit overwhelming but I guarantee it is actually quite simple to learn.

item.title: Cut Your Workflow Time In Half Using Photomechanic | Fstoppers
item.description:
Cut Your Workflow Time In Half Using Photomechanic | Fstoppers

Quite a number of years ago I had a friend that suggested I use Photomechanic to review my photos and pick the ones I want to edit (also known as "culling.") I downloaded the free trial and was immediately turned off by the archaic and confusing menus.

item.title: How to Create The Popular Matte Look in Lightroom | Fstoppers
item.description:
How to Create The Popular Matte Look in Lightroom | Fstoppers

While in Las Vegas attending the annual WPPI conference I stopped in and spent some time at the print competition. There I repeatedly noticed that many of the prints had a matte type of look to them. Now part of this is the choice of paper they print on, but also how the photos is processed plays a big part as well.

item.title: Quick Fix To Making Your RAW Photos Look Better | Fstoppers
item.description:
Quick Fix To Making Your RAW Photos Look Better | Fstoppers

Shooting photos in RAW is the choice of most professionals. Unfortunately, we all know that once you import those photos into Lightroom, the vibrant images viewed on your camera LCD suddenly look flat. What if there were a quick fix that would make your RAW images better replicate what you see on your camera?

item.title: Video Showing One of Lightroom's Most Under Utilized Tools | Fstoppers
item.description:
Video Showing One of Lightroom's Most Under Utilized Tools | Fstoppers

As a type of person that loves to figure out everything I can about gadgets and software, I am always surprised by how often I meet up with photographers that really only use the powerful programs on their computers for the most basic functions.
